citeinfo.origin: CDF, USGS, Sonoma Ecology Center: Compiled by County of Sonoma ISD GIS Central
citeinfo.title: Russian River

descript.abstract: Derived from county hydography dataset. Original data compiled by Sonoma County GIS group. Polyline layer only. The base line work is compiled from the CDF FRAP (California Department of Forestry Fire and Resource Assessment Program) Russian River and Gualala River Watersheds (River Basins) data sets which include; 1:24000 Forest Service Cartographic Feature Files and 1:24000 USGS (United States Geological Survey) DLG-3 files, Sonoma Creek Watershed data provided by Sonoma Ecology Center, watersheds that include part of Sonoma County not included in the above data are derived from USGS DLG-3 files. The original USGS DLG-3 files used in this data set were edited and new line work added. The original USGS DLG-3 files used for this data set were edge matched and edited for connectivity. The stream line work has also been centerlined through water bodies using artificial connectors. The data was then compared to USGS 7.5 minute quads and edited to reflect the USGS classification of perennial and intermittent streams. Only streams included on the USGS 7.5 minute quads where retained in this layer. USGS stream symbol number 405 was used to determine intermittent streams. 7.5 minute quads with this symbol number on it show perennial streams as a solid blue line. Some USGS 7.5 minute quads show blue line streams on them with a solid blue line, in these cases the blue line with a thickness of .008" was classified as a perennial stream while the lines with a thickness of .004" were classified as a intermittent stream. Most fields from the data sets used to compile this layer where removed, and network not retained.
descript.purpose: To display 1:24000 USGS streams as shown on the 7.5' USGS quadrangles.
descript.supplinf:
Data Source by USGS Quad:
USGS SDTS (DLG-3) (Stemple Creek, Americano Creek, Petaluma River Watersheds)
Portions of:
Duncans Mills Camp Meeker Two Rock Cotati Glen Ellen Petaluma River Sears Point
All of:
Bodega Head Valley Ford Point Reyes NE Petaluma
FRAP (Gualala River, Russian River Watersheds)
Portions of:
Duncans Mills Camp Meeker Two Rock Cotati Glen Ellen
All of:
Gualala McGuire Ridge Gube Mountain Big Foot Mountain Cloverdale Asti The Geysers Whispering Pines Stewarts Point Annapolis Tombs Creek Skaggs Springs Geyserville Jimtown Mount St Helena Plantation Fort Ross Cazadero Guerneville Healdsburg Mark West Springs Calistoga Sebastopol Santa Rosa Ken Wood
SEC (Sonoma Creek Watershed)
Portions of:
Kenwood Glen Ellen Petaluma River Sears Point
All of:
Rutherford Sonoma Cuttings Wharf

idinfo.accconst: This layer was derived from public domain data available from the USGS. It has been modified for County purposes. This layer is for use by employees of County of Sonoma & available to the public by contacting the County of Sonoma GIS Central; 2615 Paulin Drive, Santa Rosa, CA 95403. (707) 565-3819 or email inquires are accepted at: gis@sonoma-county.org
idinfo.useconst:
This layer is a visual aid only and does not reflect any official county information. These data should NOT be represented as survey data, and the official record of survey or other related official records takes precedence where there are discrepancies. It is the end user's responsibility to check the accuracy of the GIS data by comparing it with the published data from the Sonoma County Assessor / Recorder office.
You may use, copy, merge, alter, reproduce and/or create derivative works of the digital data for your agency's INTERNAL USE ONLY. You may make one (1) archival copy of the CD for back-up purposes

cntinfo.cntinst: Data requests should be directed to the contact Email address, General questions should be directed to the Contact Voice Telephone and a detailed message left. The call will be directed to the appropriate staff member.

attracc.attraccr:
Attributes correspond to information provided on United State Geological Survey 7.5 minute quads for Sonoma County California.
USGS Attribute Accuracy -- DLG attribute codes are checked by software against a table of valid codes to ensure that each attribute in a file is valid for the category and element type to which it is assigned.

horizpa.horizpar:
This GIS data are intended for small scale mapping purposes only (i.e., 1:24,000 scale or smaller), and should NOT be represented, in hard copy or digital form, as ground-surveyed data. Use of these data for any reason other than for planning purposes is NOT recommended, and the liabilities of such usage are the sole responsibility of the entity using this data.
The DLG data do not carry quantified accuracy statements. However, the following procedures are used prior to data release for distribution:
File Fidelity and Completeness -- The data are either manually digitized using equipment with a resolution of 0.001 inch and an absolute accuracy of from 0.003 to 0.005 inch, or are scanned on an automatic device with a resolution of 0.0013 inch (30 points per millimeter). For general information on accuracy, see Horizontal Positional Accuracy and Vertical Positional Accuracy.
Attribute Accuracy -- DLG attribute codes are checked by software against a table of valid codes to ensure that each attribute in a file is valid for the category and element type to which it is assigned.
Topological Fidelity -- The topological structure of each DLG file is fully validated by software. Lines are checked to assure that all intersections have nodes present. Validation of DLG data is performed for each category within a file.
Edge Matching -- Edge matching ensures that features are matched in content, position, and attribution along a common edge (neatline). Edge matching is conducted interactively at the time of original compilation and some revisions using source materials for verification. Edge align software automatically compares position and attribution, and aligns features that are within 0.020 inches of each other. Features that are out of tolerance and/or have different attributes are identified.
Quality Control Flags -- Information in the header of the DLG-3 indicates the status of the file with respect to the edge matching described above. Twelve bytes at the end of record A.1 in the standard distribution format and at the end of record 3 in the optional distribution format of the ASCII file are set aside for quality control flags. A more detailed description of these codes may be found in the USGS publication titled "Digital Line Graphs from 1:24,000-Scale Maps--Data Users Guide 1."
File Fidelity and completemess-- The data are either manually digitized using equipmetn with a resolution of 0.001 inch and an absolute accuracy of from 0.003 to 0.005 inche or are scanned on an automatic device with a resolution of 0.0013 inch.
Horizontal positional accuracy is based upon the use of USGS source quadrangles which are compiled to meet National Map Accuracy Standards (NMAS). NMAS horizontal accuracy requires that at least 90 percent of points tested are within 0.02 inches of the true position. The digital data are estimated to contain a horizontal positional error of less than or equal to 0.003 inches standard error in the two component directions relative to the source quadrangle.

procstep.procdesc: Metadata imported and extensively modified. Data complied from various sources

citeinfo.origin: California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection
citeinfo.title: 1:24,000 hydrography

dataqual.logic: lines begin and end at nodes, lines connect to each other at nodes, lines do not extend through nodes.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: A ranking of the relative sizes of streams within a watershed based on the nature of their tributaries. The smallest unbranched tributary is called first order, the stream receiving the tributary is called second order, and so on
Indicates if the Stream is Perenial or Intermittent

cntinfo.cntinst: Data requests should be directed to the contact Email address, General questions should be directed to the Contact Voice Telephone and a detailed message left. The call will be directed to the appropriate staff member.

distinfo.resdesc: Available by Mail only at this time.
distinfo.distliab: The majority of this data is available from the USGS, and CDF and is in the public domain. Portions of it were provided by the Sonoma Ecology Center. It has been altered for County use.. The County of Sonoma assumes no responsibility arising from use of this information by the public or by private agencies. THE MAPS AND ASSOCIATED DATA ARE PROVIDED WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, expressed or implied, including but not limited to, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. Do not make any business decisions based on this data before validating your decision with the appropriate County office. You may use, copy, merge, alter, reproduce and/or create derivative works of the digital data for your agency's INTERNAL USE ONLY. You may make one (1) archival copy of the CD for back-up purposes. However, the data may NOT be re-distributed to a third-party source in hard copy (paper) or digital form (CD, other media, or via the Internet) without the express written permission of the Sonoma County ISD/GIS Group. All rights not specifically granted herein are reserved to the copyright owners. Use of this data constitutes acknowledgment of, and agreement to, all of the stated provisions.

stdorder.ordering: The ISD/GIS Group is currently charging $126 per CD to cover staff time and the cost of reproduction. Currently, one (1) vector data CD will be sent to the data requestor in ESRI ArcView shapefile format. We do not automatically provide updates to the data. A request for updates or replacement of lost CD(s) is treated as a new request. Make requests directly to the GIS Request Line at (707) 565-3819 or via E-mail at gis@sonoma-county.org. Please include your contact information, including name, agency, telephone number, and E-mail address. Requests are normally shipped within 10 business days.

distinfo.custom: Should be made the GIS request line (707) 565-3819.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Derived from county hydography dataset. Original data compiled by Sonoma County GIS group. Polyline layer only. The base line work is compiled from the CDF FRAP (California Department of Forestry Fire and Resource Assessment Program) Russian River and Gualala River Watersheds (River Basins) data sets which include; 1:24000 Forest Service Cartographic Feature Files and 1:24000 USGS (United States Geological Survey) DLG-3 files, Sonoma Creek Watershed data provided by Sonoma Ecology Center, watersheds that include part of Sonoma County not included in the above data are derived from USGS DLG-3 files. The original USGS DLG-3 files used in this data set were edited and new line work added. The original USGS DLG-3 files used for this data set were edge matched and edited for connectivity. The stream line work has also been centerlined through water bodies using artificial connectors. The data was then compared to USGS 7.5 minute quads and edited to reflect the USGS classification of perennial and intermittent streams. Only streams included on the USGS 7.5 minute quads where retained in this layer. USGS stream symbol number 405 was used to determine intermittent streams. 7.5 minute quads with this symbol number on it show perennial streams as a solid blue line. Some USGS 7.5 minute quads show blue line streams on them with a solid blue line, in these cases the blue line with a thickness of .008" was classified as a perennial stream while the lines with a thickness of .004" were classified as a intermittent stream. Most fields from the data sets used to compile this layer where removed, and network not retained.

Consts.useLimit: This data is intended for use with Getting to Know ArcGIS for Desktop. It may have been modified for training purposes and should not be used for analysis outside of this context.
